On Escalation Ticket # 00418964 the new comment has been added: Oana-Cristina Rus:

Hi @WaitingOnEngineer,

The images attached contain a message that is displayed when the customers don't have enough space.

More details you find in the following procedure:

--- CODE ---
13.6. Implement safety-belt settings when no values are present in the database
--- CODE ---


--- CODE ---
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10bRDO5QVg8eXYAAXysRC7fAoGsqWDnw4/edit?gid=1670912709#gid=1670912709
--- CODE ---

In this case, is recommended the following:

1. Use Audit Log Backup to reduce the logs stored in the database
2. Delete older systems and audit log backups
3. Tune policies to reduce incoming log count

[DevOps CommentId:10828922]

On Escalation Ticket # 00418964 the new comment has been added: Hello,
Thank you for the reply.
However, the Epp server space is filling up due to the /tmp file which is not covered audit log backup.
could there be a reason why the /tmp file is filling up at this rate?

On Escalation Ticket # 00418964 the new comment has been added: Oana-Cristina Rus:

Hi,

It is true the audit will help if the customer has many logs on the server.

I think that can cause the reported space problem.

Can you let us know which types of files the customer has in the /tmp directory?

@WaitingOnEngineerÂ 

[DevOps CommentId:10856272]
